title: Aggressive Bull Market Speculation on Ethereum Has Not Yet Begun, According to Analytics Firm Kaiko - The Daily Hodl
summary: According to Kaiko, a crypto analytics firm, aggressive bull market speculation on Ethereum (ETH) has not yet begun, despite the token's recent price increase. The firm notes that while there is some hype around ETH ETF applications, the data suggests that traders have not yet begun to position themselves for a rally. Derivatives data also indicates that recent ETH moves have been driven by spot markets rather than perpetual futures, which suggests that traders are not using leverage in anticipation of an ETH ETF. Additionally, open interest in ETH futures has surged ahead of price, but this has not yet led to a major build-up in open interest typical of a bull market. At the time of writing, ETH is trading for $2,473.

title: MetaMask introduces Ethereum validator staking feature, powered by Consensys - The Block
summary:
MetaMask, a popular crypto wallet application, has partnered with Consensys Staking to offer Ethereum validator staking to its users. With this feature, users can stake at least 32 ETH (currently valued at around $80,000) to run a validator node on their behalf, securing the Ethereum network. This comes after Ethereum's transition to a proof-of-stake network in September 2022, known as 'The Merge.'

Unlike other staking providers that require pooling smaller amounts of funds together, MetaMask's new offering promises no pooling and no hardware or software requirements. Instead, the 32 ETH stake is used to run a validator node through the Consensys Staking service, which already operates validators totaling about 4% of all staked ETH.

MetaMask currently promises about 4% annual yield on the rewards, before taking a 10% fee. However, the company notes that this yield may increase or decrease due to the inherently random chance of any given validator's block being selected to add

title: Will ETH Price Hit $2000? Expanding Channel Pattern Sets Dive Below $2400 - CoinGape
summary:
The article discusses the recent price correction in Ethereum (ETH) and the potential for the price to reach $2000. The cryptocurrency market is experiencing increased selling pressure, with Grayscale's continued sale of its Bitcoin holdings contributing to the downturn. ETH formed an expanding channel pattern, which indicates increased uncertainty among market participants, and the price is currently trading at $2467, down 9% from two weeks ago.

The article highlights that the intraday trading volume in Ether is $4.63 billion, indicating a 39% loss, and the last two months' recovery in Ethereum price can be followed using two diverging trendlines of an expanding channel pattern. The ETH price witnessed a reversal from the upper trendline on January 12th, initiating a new bear cycle within the channel, and the price is currently trying to hold above local support of $2400.

The article also notes that Ethereum's implied volatility (IV) experienced a significant decline, dropping from 64% to 47%,

title: Crypto Whales Taking Advantage of Bitcoin, Ethereum and Chainlink Dips, According to Lookonchain - The Daily Hodl
summary: According to Lookonchain, a blockchain tracking firm, crypto whales are taking advantage of the recent market correction in digital assets. The firm detected a "smart whale" who bought up 3,600 Ethereum (ETH) worth $8.9 million when the price dropped to a lower level. This whale has a history of profitable trades and has made a profit of around $25.8 million currently. Lookonchain also identified a whale who purchased 601,949 Chainlink (LINK) worth $8.9 million when the price dropped to $14.81. The price of LINK appears to have stabilized after the large whale purchase. Additionally, a crypto whale withdrew nearly $30 million worth of Bitcoin (BTC) from Binance as the price fell below $42,000. It seems that this whale is buying BTC.

title: Ethereum: Will high network activity lead to a price hike - AMBCrypto News

title: Crypto - Ethereum spot ETF unlikely to get US SEC approval before May says JP Morgan - ForexLive
summary: JP Morgan has expressed skepticism that the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) will approve an Ethereum (ETH) spot exchange-traded fund (ETF) before May. Despite sympathizing with the argument that ETH should be classified as a commodity, JP Morgan believes the SEC is unlikely to make a decision in the next three months. This news may disappoint those waiting for an ETH ETF, but it does not come as a surprise, as the SEC has been cautious in approving cryptocurrency ETFs.

title: Ethereum (ETH) Upside, Bitcoin (BTC) 'Max Pain' Ahead: Analyst - CoinGape
summary: The article discusses the differing opinions among cryptocurrency analysts regarding the future trajectory of Bitcoin (BTC) and Ethereum (ETH). While some analysts predict a peak of $100,000 for Bitcoin, others believe that Ethereum has more upside potential. The article highlights the potential introduction of an Exchange-Traded Fund (ETF) product for Ethereum as a catalyst for its growth. Additionally, the article mentions a debate between analysts on the X platform, with some comparing Ethereum to "the stupid man's Bitcoin" and others predicting that it will overtake Bitcoin as the dominant player in the market in 2024.

title: How Solana, Sui made gains from ETH outflows - AMBCrypto English
summary: The article discusses how Solana (SOL) and Sui (SUI) have gained from Ethereum (ETH) outflows. According to Wormhole data, around $370 million in liquidity shifted away from Ethereum in the last month, with Sui and Solana accounting for about 90% of this outflow. The article analyzes the volume and price trends of these networks, showing that Sui has experienced an uptrend in volume and price, while Solana has witnessed a decline in price. The article concludes that the outflow of Ethereum liquidity to Solana and Sui may have influenced their overall transaction volume and price trends.

title: Will Ethereum staking help raise ETH’s prices? - AMBCrypto News
summary: The article discusses the potential impact of Ethereum (ETH) staking on the cryptocurrency's price. According to the analysis, the amount of ETH staked as a percentage of the total circulating supply has increased significantly since the Shapella Upgrade went live last year, reaching 24.5% as of the writing. This increase in staking has led to a decrease in liquid supply, which has resulted in a scarcity of ETH in the market. The article suggests that this scarcity could lead to steadier prices in the future, similar to a store of value, and could potentially result in a massive price explosion. The article also mentions that the annualized financial return per validator has decreased from 5.2% in June 2023 to 3.64% at press time, despite an increase in demand for staking. The article concludes by stating that the ETH scarcity is the highest it has ever been, and could lead to a green portfolio for those who have invested in ETH.

title: From 0.34 Ethereum to $500K: Trader's Fortune Skyrockets in 8 Hours - Examiner.com
summary: An anonymous trader turned a modest investment of 0.34 Ethereum (ETH) into a staggering $550,000 in just eight hours, according to on-chain tracker Lookonchain. The trader purchased 80 million FERRET meme tokens after they went live for trading and made a series of strategic sales, culminating in a profit of $54,000 from selling 11.8 million tokens and retaining FERRET tokens valued at $495,000. The trader's actions have raised eyebrows and questions about the mysterious ways of the crypto market, with some speculating about the trader's possible link to the FERRET token creator. Previous similar incidents of substantial gains from meme coins have also raised questions about the timing and insider connections in such trades. Despite the rapid riches, it is important to note that the crypto market can be volatile and unpredictable, and any investment decisions should be made with caution and thorough research.

title: What Are Parallelized EVMs? A Beginner's Guide - Unchained - Unchained
summary:
Parallelized EVMs (PEVMs) are a new innovation in the Ethereum ecosystem that enhance blockchain scalability and efficiency by allowing multiple transactions to be executed simultaneously rather than sequentially. PEVMs leverage the power of parallel processing to reduce transaction times and fees, making Ethereum more user-friendly and accessible to developers and users alike.

PEVMs have the potential to significantly impact Ethereum's scalability, allowing it to handle a much larger volume of activity and paving the way for faster and cheaper transactions. This could lead to widespread adoption of decentralized applications (dApps) and DeFi, bringing the power of blockchain to a broader audience.

However, PEVMs also present some challenges, such as increased technical complexity, potential security risks, and backward compatibility issues with existing smart contracts. Implementing and maintaining robust PEVMs can be technically demanding, and developers and users may face a steep learning curve.

Despite these challenges, PEVMs are an exciting development in the Ethereum ecosystem, and their

title: Ethereum Remains the Dominant Blockchain for Developers: Report - CryptoPotato
summary: The latest report by Electric Capital reveals that Ethereum remains the dominant blockchain for developers, with over 70% of new contract codes first deployed on the network. The report also shows a spread in the distribution of developers globally, with more crypto devs living outside North America. The number of multi-chain developers expanded in 2023, with 34% of developers working on multiple blockchains, and cross-pollination occurring between Ethereum, BNB Chain, Polygon, and Avalanche. Bitcoin recorded a 25% drop in monthly active developers, while over 1000 developers have supported the network since 2017. The total number of blockchain developers fell by almost a quarter in 2023, with newcomers less than a year in crypto contributing to the majority of the losses. However, those who have been in crypto for over a year continue to grow and contribute to the ecosystem, with 75% of codes by such developers.

title: Cardano (ADA) Surpassed Ethereum (ETH) on Multiple Fronts: Details - CryptoPotato
summary: Cardano (ADA) has surpassed Ethereum (ETH) in several areas, including whale transaction volumes and non-fungible token (NFT) sales. According to IntoTheBlock data, Cardano whales have settled an average of $13 billion in large daily transactions, compared to Ethereum's $5 billion. Additionally, Cardano has made progress in the NFT field with an NFT sales volume of over $7.6 million, while Ethereum's NFT sales volume has declined by 23% on a monthly basis. Despite this, Cardano's ADA has underperformed ETH in recent weeks, with a 14% plunge on a weekly scale. However, some experts believe that Cardano could be on the verge of a rally due to upcoming events, including the Coinbase v. SEC lawsuit, which could potentially trigger a "mega altcoin run."

title: Ethereum Fork PulseChain Records TVL Surge - CoinGape
summary: PulseChain, an Ethereum fork, has experienced a significant surge in Total Value Locked (TVL) in recent weeks, reaching $403 million. This growth has positioned it as the 11th largest blockchain in terms of TVL, according to DefiLlama. PulseChain houses 34 protocols and has seen a TVL increase of 110% over the past week. PulseX, the largest protocol on PulseChain, is a decentralized exchange (DEX) that contributes $234.45 million to the chain. While PulseChain accounts for only 0.71% of the total TVL market, its recent rise is notable, particularly following the approval of the first spot Bitcoin ETF. The chain's interoperability with Ethereum and integration of major stablecoins like $DAI, $USDC, and $USDT have been cited as potential growth drivers. However, PulseChain has faced controversies, including legal issues and criticism for exaggerated claims.
